TITLE Mexican Chicken Casserole

# Poach [1.75 lbs chicken breasts] with [4.5 oz green chiles] and [1 cup chicken stock]
# Remove chicken from cooking liquid, reserving cooking liquid; cool chicken.
# Shred meat and set aside.
# Preheat oven to 350F.
# Saute [1 cup onion] minced in [2 tsp olive oil]. When the onions start to soften add [4.5 oz green chiles]. Continue until softened and add reserved cooking liquid, [1 cup evaporated skim milk], [4 oz Monterey Jack cheese] shredded, [2 oz cream cheese], [10 oz enchilada sauce]. Stir well.
# Stir in shredded chicken; cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
# Place 4 of the [12 item corn tortillas] in the bottom of a 2-quart casserole which has been lightly greased.
# Spoon 2 cups chicken mixture over tortillas. Repeat layers twice, ending with chicken mixture. Sprinkle with [2 oz cheddar cheese] shredded.
# Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
